title: Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs)
content: Artificial Neural Networks or ANNs are powerful computational models. They draw inspiration directly from the intricate structure and function of the human brain.
narration: Artificial Neural Networks or ANNs are powerful computational models. They draw inspiration directly from the intricate structure and function of the human brain.

title: Inspiration from the Brain
content:
Inspired by the human brain.
Mimic biological neurons.
Organized in layers.
image_desc: Human brain neurons synapse. Type: illustration
narration: The fundamental idea behind ANNs is to replicate the way our brains process information. ANNs strive to emulate the complex network of neurons and their connections. This layered arrangement allows for complex pattern recognition and data processing.

title: The Building Blocks: Neurons
content:
Interconnected nodes.
Called "neurons" or "nodes".
Process and transmit information.
narration: At the heart of an ANN are interconnected nodes often referred to as neurons or nodes. These neurons act as processing units receiving inputs performing calculations and then transmitting the results to other neurons in the network. This interconnectedness is crucial for the network's ability to learn and adapt.

title: Layers in Neural Networks
content:
Image Description: Deep neural network architecture. Type: diagram
Caption: A typical neural network with input, hidden, and output layers.
Narration:
ANNs are typically organized into layers: an input layer, one or more hidden layers, and an output layer. The input layer receives the initial data, the hidden layers perform complex computations, and the output layer produces the final result. The depth and complexity of these layers determine the network's ability to solve intricate problems.
image_desc: Deep neural network architecture. Type: diagram
narration: ANNs are typically organized into layers an input layer one or more hidden layers and an output layer. The input layer receives the initial data the hidden layers perform complex computations and the output layer produces the final result. The depth and complexity of these layers determine the network's ability to solve intricate problems.
